location.description: azure location name as returned by the command : az account list-locations -o table

resource_group.description: Name of the resource group to create all resources

optout_telemetry.description: If set to true, will disable telemetry for azhop. See https://azure.github.io/az-hop/deploy/telemetry.html

use_existing_rg.description: If using an existing resource group set to true. Default is false. When using an existing resource group make sure the location match the one of the existing resource group

tags.description: Additional tags to be added on the Resource Group

anf.description: Define an Azure Netapp Files (ANF) account, single pool and volume. If not present, assume that there is an existing NFS share for the users home directory

azurefiles.description: For small deployments you can use Azure Files instead of ANF for the home directory

mounts.description: Mounts will be listed in the Files menu of the OnDemand portal and automatically mounted on all compute nodes and remote desktop nodes

key_vault_readers.description: Identity (object id) to grant read access to az-hop key vault (optional)

locked_down_network.description: When working in a locked down network, uncomment and fill out this section

linux_base_image.description: Can be either an image reference or an image_id from the image registry or a custom managed image

linux_base_plan.description: linux image plan if required, format is publisher:product:name

windows_base_image.description: Can be either an image reference or an image_id from the image registry or a custom managed image

jumpbox.description: Jumpbox VM configuration, only needed when deploying thru a public IP and without a configured deployer VM

lustre.description: Create a Lustre cluster in the environment (optional).

users.description: List of users to be created on this environment

usergroups.description: List of user groups to be created

cvmfs_eessi.description: Enable CernVM virtual file system for European Environment for Scientific Software Installations

slurm.description: scheduler to be installed and configured (openpbs, slurm)

database.description: If using an existing Managed MariaDB instance for SLURM accounting, specify these values

authentication.description: # Authentication configuration for ondemand portal. Default is basic authentication. For oidc authentication, store the OIDCClient secret as a secret named <oidc-client-id>-password in the keyvault used by az-hop

images.description: List of images to be defined

bastion.description: Create a Bastion in the bastion subnet  (optional).

vpn_gateway.description: Create a VPN Gateway in the gateway subnet (optional).

image_gallery.description: Create the shared image gallery to store custom VM images.

autoscale.description: Autoscale default settings for all queues, can be overriden on each queue depending on the VM type if needed

queues.description: List of queues (node arrays in CycleCloud)

applications.description: Configure applications in OnDemand web portal

dns.description: Specify DNS forwarders available in the network

log_analytics.description: Create a log analytics workspace to enable monitoring and alerting

compute_vm_identity.description: Create a user-assigned managed identity that will be applied to the compute VMs

monitoring.description: If set to true, it will install the Azure Monitor Agent on the infrastructure VMs deployed by az-hop. If set to false, it is assumed that the agent is installed by policy.

alerting.description: If set to true, it will create alert rules associated with az-hop. Enablement of alerting will require the specification of an admin email to send alerts to.

nat_gateway.description: Create a NAT Gateway to enable outbound connectivity

private_dns.description: Configuration of a private DNS zone to create

vm_size.description: The size of VM to use when deploying a new active directory domain as part of AZHOP

hybrid_benefit.description: Will hybrid benefit be used on the vm that is running the active directory domain vm being deployed for az-hop.

high_availability.description: Should a second domain controller be deployed when include a new active directory with the az-hop deployment.

homefs_size_tb.description: Size of the ANF pool and unique volume (min: 4TB, max: 100TB)

homefs_service_level.description: Service level of the ANF volume, can be: Standard, Premium, Ultra

dual_protocol.description: Whether to enable SMB support. false by default

alert_threshold.description: If alerting is enabled, this value will be used to determine when to trigger alerts

name.description: The domain name that the Az-Hop infrastructure will use.

domain_join_ou.description: The domain OU where new AZ-HOP computer objects will be added to the domain.

use_existing_dc.description: Flag for identifying whether an existing Active Directory should be used or if an AD controller should be deployed with AZ-HOP

username.description: The username of the account that will be used to perform domain join activities.

password_key_vault_name.description: The name of the keyvault where the domain join user's password will be stored as a secret. The identity being used for the deployment will need to have secret read on this vault.

password_key_vault_resource_group_name.description: The resource group name where the key vault holding the domain join user secret is deployed.

password_key_vault_secret_name.description: The name of the secret for the domain join user password.

domain_controller_names.description: A list of hostnames for the domain controllers that will be used as a target for az-hop domain activities.

domain_controller_ip_addresses.description: A list of IP addresses for the existing domain controllers for use in ASG and NSG rules allowing domain access.

private_dns_servers.description: A list of IP addresses for the existing DNS servers where the AD domain records exist.

idle_timeout.description: Idle time in seconds before shutting down VMs - default to 1800 like in CycleCloud

name.description: Name of the image gallery to be created

image.description: Can be either an image reference or an image_id from the image registry or a custom managed image

plan.description: Image plan specification (when needed for the image). Terms must be accepted prior to deployment

ssh_port.description: Defaults to 22. Change this to, e.g., 2222, if security policies (like 'zero trust') in your tenant automatically block access to port 22 from the internet

use_as_deployer.description: If set to true, will use the CycleCloud VM as the deployer VM

web_server_path.description: Path to the web server path. Defaults to /cyclecloud

distribution_method.description: The distribution method for the CycleCloud installation. Defaults to 'azhop'

name.description: Name of the database resource to be created

user.description: Admin user of the database for which the password will be retrieved from the azhop keyvault

fqdn.description: FQDN of the managed instance, when using an existing one

ip.description: IP of the managed private endpoint if the FQDN is not registered in a private DNS

capacity.description: Size of the Lustre file system in TB

hsm.description: Use existing storage account for the archive (optional). If not included, will use az-hop storage account.

resource_group.description: name of the resource group containing the ASG. Default to the resource group containing azhop resources

names.description: list of ASG names mapping to the one defined in az-hop

name.description: Domain name to be resolved by the forwarder

ips.description: Comma delimited list of the IP addresses of the forwarder

vnet_resource_group.description: Resource Group of the VNET to peer to

anyOf.description: Name of queue (max. 8 characters, lowercase). This is to leave space for node suffix, as hostnames are limited to 15 characters by domain join and NETBIOS constraints.

vm_size.description: Azure VM instance type, e.g. Standard_F2s_v2

max_core_count.description: Maximum number of cores that can be allocated for the entire queue.

max_count.description: Maximum number of nodes that can be allocated for the entire queue.

image.description: Can be either an image reference or an image_id from the image registry or a custom managed image

plan.description: Image plan specification (when needed for the image). Terms must be accepted prior to deployment

EnableAcceleratedNetworking.description: Whether to enable AccelNet. Defaults to false

spot.description: Whether to use spot instances. Defaults to false

ColocateNodes.description: Whether to create placement groups (SLURM only). Defaults to true

idle_timeout.description: Idle time (seconds) before shutting down VMs. Choose lower than autoscale.idle_timeout

MaxScaleSetSize.description: Maximum number of VMs in a scale set (default: 100). Lowering may make it easier to provision VMs from Azure, increasing beyond 100 requires raising Azure limit via support ticket.

EphemeralOSDisk.description: Use ephemeral boot disk for VM, if supported. Defaults to false

type.description: Type of queue - mandatory for remoteviz nodes

description.description: Description of the queue that will appear in the node selection choice of the ood portal

shareable.description: Whether the remote visualization node can be shared by multiple users. Defaults to false

location.description: Azure Location of the queue. Only used it for multi-region scenario. Defaults to the location of the az-hop deployment

subnet.description: Subnet of the queue. Only used and required for multi-region scenario. Format for the remove subnet is <resource_group>/<vnet_name>/<subnet_name> Defaults to the subnet of the az-hop deployment

healthchecks.description: Whether to enable healthchecks. Defaults to true

cluster_name.description: Name of slurm cluster for accounting, defaults to 'slurm'. WARNING: changing this value on a running cluster will cause slurmctld to fail to start. This is a safety check to prevent accounting errors. To override, remove /var/spool/slurmd/clustername .

slurm_version.description: SLURM version to install. Currently supported: only [20.11.9 | 22.05.3] with cyclecloud_slurm_version==2.7.x and [22.05.9 | 23.02.5] with cyclecloud_slurm_version==3.0.x.

cyclecloud_slurm_version.description: CycleCloud for SLURM project version as defined in https://github.com/Azure/cyclecloud-slurm/releases. Currently supported: 2.7.0-2.7.2, 3.0.4.
